definition: to tackle a difficult job (idiom)/to do sth reluctantly
to exhort/to make an effort
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold

sentences.english: He had to hit the bullet and give into his boss's unreasonable demands.
sentences.chinese: 是他勉为其难，让步接受了老板的苛刻要求。

sentences.english: Life was hard enough already without four extra mouths to feed.
sentences.chinese: 生活已经足够艰辛，要再多喂四张嘴也是勉为其难。

sentences.english: He had to bite the bullet and give in to his boss's unreasonable demands.
sentences.chinese: 他只好勉为其难，听从老板无理的要求。

sentences.english: Since Mary has just begun to learn French, she finds that she is beyond reading the novel in French.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽刚刚开始学法语，读法语小说实在是勉为其难。

sentences.english: It's hard for me to predict what will happen in 25 years.
sentences.chinese: 让我预测25年后会发生什么有些勉为其难了。

sentences.english: Under working circumstances do you always do what you are reluctant to do?
sentences.chinese: 工作环境中常常勉为其难的做事情吗？

sentences.english: I wish I was special, so fucking special…
sentences.chinese: 俺们也是勉为其难，谁愿意抛头露面招人嫌呢？

definition: to refuse would be impolite
deference is no substitute for obedience (idiom)/(said to accept sb's request, invitation etc)
pinyin: gong1 jing4 bu4 ru2 cong2 ming4

definition: unwilling
shameless
can't persuade/unable to make (sb) change their mind/unable to resist (sb)
lit. to push the boat with the current/fig. to take advantage of the situation for one's own benefit
to repel/to decline
to resign oneself to part with what one treasures
to decline (an appointment, invitation etc)
to achieve with difficulty/only just up to the task/barely adequate
to condescend/to deign
to show deference or praise publicly
half willing and half unwilling (idiom); to yield after making a show of resistance
to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
to drop (subject etc)
to force someone to do something
